acquirerIntro.title: Who Can Be an
acquirerIntro.intro: Becoming an Acquirer is a significant step for merchants who wish to expand their payment processing capabilities and offer seamless transactions to their customers. An Acquirer is typically a merchant or organization that is responsible for processing card payments and managing merchant accounts.
acquirerIntro.requirement1: Merchant must have been operating for a minimum of 6 months.
acquirerIntro.requirement2: Merchant should have processed at least 100 transactions during this period.
acquirerIntro.requirement3: Maintain a good transaction record with minimal chargebacks or disputes.
acquirerIntro.requirement4: Provide valid business registration and compliance documents.
acquirerIntro.requirement5: Demonstrate the ability to manage payment settlements and reconciliation.
acquirerIntro.whyText: Becoming an Acquirer allows merchants to take control of their payment processing, improve transaction efficiency, and offer a better experience to their customers. It opens up new business opportunities and helps build trust with partners and clients.
acquirerIntro.benefit1: Direct access to payment networks and faster settlements.
acquirerIntro.benefit2: Enhanced security and fraud prevention tools.
acquirerIntro.benefit3: Ability to onboard and manage multiple merchants.
acquirerIntro.benefit4: Customizable payment solutions for different business needs.
acquirerIntro.benefit5: Detailed reporting and analytics for transaction monitoring.
acquirerIntro.benefit6: Priority support and dedicated account management.

regBulk.title: Merchant Bulk Registration

regBulk.desc: This feature allows Sub-Acquirers to onboard multiple merchants simultaneously using a predefined Excel template.

steps.title: Step 1: Navigate to Bulk Registration area

A modal titled ‘Create new merchants’ will open.

steps.title: Step 2: Understand the Upload Model

Download Sample Excel – click this to get the correct format.
Important Note – file must be .xlsx, and all images/documents must be preuploaded.

steps.title: Step 3: Download & Fill the Sample Excel
points: Click ‘Download Sample Excel’ to get the correct format.
Important Rules to follow when filling the excel file:
rules: Every row must contain valid entries for all columns.
Email must be unique and properly formatted.
Mobile number must follow a valid format (+94).
Ensure that all uploaded document URLs are publicly accessible to anyone with the link.

Since the merchant evaluation process involves multiple layers (Sub-Acquirer, SriPay, and Alipay), granting access restricted to a specific party would not be practical. Therefore, all uploaded document URLs should be publicly accessible to ensure seamless review across all approval stages.

regSelf.title: Merchant Self Sign-Up
regSelf.intro: The Merchant Self Sign-Up feature allows Sub-Acquirers to enable their merchants to register independently using a dedicated, branded sign-up link. This simplifies the onboarding process by eliminating the need for manual merchant creation from the Sub-Acquirer dashboard.

steps.title: Step 1: Send an Email Request
steps.desc: To activate this feature, you must send a formal request to SriPay to enable Merchant Self Sign-Up for your Sub-Acquirer account.
steps.subject: Request for Merchant Self Sign-Up Enablement
include: Preferred branding details (optional – logo, color theme)

steps.title: Step 2: SriPay Review & Enablement
points: SriPay will review your request and configure a custom sign-up URL.
The sign-up page will include your Sub-Acquirer’s name and branding colors.
You will be notified once the link is ready to be shared with merchants.

steps.title: Step 3: Merchant Access & KYC Submission
points: Merchants can use the self-registration link to:
Create their account
Submit KYC information
Upload required documents
All submitted applications will appear under your Sub-Acquirer Dashboard for review.

steps.title: Step 4: Proceed with Standard Evaluation Process
steps.desc: Once submitted, these merchants will follow the same approval flow:
steps.flow: Sub-Acquirer Review → SriPay Review → Alipay Review → Activation

benefits: Saves time for Sub-Acquirers by reducing manual entry.
Enables merchants to take ownership of their onboarding.
Ensures faster scaling for large merchant acquisition campaigns.
Fully integrated into the existing evaluation and compliance workflow.
regSelf.note: All merchant data collected through the self-sign-up page is secure and traceable under your Sub-Acquirer ID.

storeUserAssign.title: Assigning Store Users
storeUserAssign.desc: Store User Management allows the Acquirer to assign users specifically to a store. These users will be responsible for handling store-level tasks such as viewing transactions, accessing terminals, or processing orders depending on their roles.
storeUserAssign.instructionsTitle: To Assign users for a specific store:
steps: From the store list, click View (: > View) on the relevant store.
Navigate to the Add user to the outlet section inside the store profile.
storeUserAssign.note: Note: Store users should be added by the merchant before assigning them to a store.

storeCreate.title: Creating a New Store
step1: Go to the Merchants tab and locate the merchant for whom you want to create a store.
Click on the 3-dot action menu next to the merchant entry.
From the action menu, click Create Store to begin the process.
step2Fields: Store Name – The official name of the store/outlet.
Store Phone – Direct store contact number.
Store Email – Store’s email address for communication.
Province / District / City / Street – Physical location fields to map the store accurately.
Store QR currency – Select the preferred currency for your store’s QR code transactions.
Store Website – Include the store’s official website URL. If a dedicated outlet site is unavailable, you may use the main business website.
storeCreate.step2FieldsNote: These fields help ensure each store is uniquely identifiable by address and contact details.
storeCreate.step3Intro: To enable seamless settlement of funds, please provide your store’s bank account details. You may configure both Primary and Secondary settlement accounts. Only one account can be set as the default settlement account.
storeCreate.step3PrimaryDesc: This account will be used as the default for receiving settlement payments unless changed manually.
step3PrimaryFields: Bank Type: Choose between Local or International bank account.
Settlement Currency: Select LKR or USD depending on your account preference.
Bank Name: Choose your bank from the list provided.
Bank Code: Input the official bank code.
Branch Name: Enter the name of the bank branch.
Branch Code: Provide the correct branch code for reference.
Account Number: Enter the full bank account number used for settlements.
Account Name: Input the name under which the account is registered.
storeCreate.step3SecondaryDesc: This optional account acts as a backup for settlement purposes and can be activated when needed.
storeCreate.step3SecondaryFieldsTitle: Required Fields (same as Primary Bank Account)
storeCreate.step3SecondaryNote: You can also toggle the option to Set as default settlement account if you prefer this to be the primary method of receiving payments.
storeCreate.step3Note: Note: Ensure all information is accurate. Incorrect details may delay or reject settlements.
storeCreate.step3Next: Click Next to proceed once all mandatory details are entered correctly.
storeCreate.step4Intro: To finalize your store registration, please complete the following required details. This information helps verify and activate your store for customer-facing services and settlements.
storeCreate.step4FrontDesc: Upload clear exterior photos of your store front. This helps in authenticating the physical existence and visibility of the outlet.
storeCreate.step4FrontNote: Ensure the store name board is clearly visible in the image.
storeCreate.step4InteriorDesc: Upload clear interior photos of your store. This helps in verifying the operational nature and layout of your outlet.
storeCreate.step4InteriorNote: Make sure the images represent the actual setup of the store (e.g., counters, displays, signage).
storeCreate.step4MobileDesc: Provide a valid mobile number for store-level communication and verification.
step4MobileList: Click “Verify Phone Number” to receive and confirm a verification code.
storeCreate.step4EmailDesc: Enter a valid email address for official communications related to settlements, support, and notifications.
step4EmailList: Click “Verify Email” to authenticate the email before submission.
storeCreate.step4VerifyNote: Both phone and email must be verified before submitting the setup.
storeCreate.step4Submit: Click Submit once all fields are filled and verified to complete your store onboarding.
storeCreate.step5Intro: Once a store is submitted, it enters the Pending Requests stage for review and evaluation by the acquirer. The approval process ensures store legitimacy and compliance before activation.

terminalManagement.title: Terminal Management
terminalManagement.desc: Terminal Management allows the Acquirer to configure and associate terminals (typically POS devices or QR interfaces) with each store. This setup is essential for enabling real-time transactions, QR scanning, and accurate transaction mapping per outlet.
terminalManagement.accessDesc: To manage terminals for a specific store:
accessSteps: Select View (: > View) on the desired store.
terminalManagement.addDesc1: After a store is approved, you can begin assigning terminals for transactions. A terminal represents a specific POS (Point of Sale) device or checkout point within the store.
terminalManagement.addDesc2: Click on Create New Terminal on the Terminal section.
terminalManagement.optionTitle: Option Selection – Single vs. Multiple Terminals
terminalManagement.optionDesc: Start by selecting whether you want to create a Single Terminal or Multiple Terminals.
optionList: Single Terminal: For stores with one checkout or payment point.
Multiple Terminals: For stores with several counters/devices (e.g., supermarkets or chains).
terminalManagement.optionNext: Click Next after making your selection.
singleList: Terminal ID: A unique identifier (e.g., T001).
Terminal Name: Assign a label (e.g., Terminal A).
Terminals: Shows current number of terminals in the store.
terminalManagement.singleNext: Click Yes to proceed and save the terminal.
multiList: Enter Number of Terminals you wish to create (e.g., 5).
terminalManagement.multiNext: Click Submit to auto-generate terminal IDs and assign them to the store.
statusList: They will appear in the Terminals Table.
Status will indicate whether each terminal is active or deactive.
You can manage each terminal individually via the Action button.
terminalManagement.statusNote: When activating or deactivating a terminal, a confirmation model will appear. You must click "OK" to proceed with the action.

merchantSuspend.title: Suspending Merchant
steps: Click on the three dots ”⋮” next to the merchant name.
A popup will prompt you to enter a reason before confirming the suspension.
merchantSuspend.note: Suspended merchants will be moved to the Suspended tab and can only be reactivated by contacting SriPay.

activatingSuspend.title: Activating Suspended Merchant
activatingSuspend.howToTitle: To activate a merchant after suspending:
steps: Click on the three dots ”⋮” and select Approve.
Upon approval, the merchant status will change from ‘suspended’ to ‘approved’.

agreementUpload.note: This ensures transparency and legal compliance between SriPay, the Acquirer, and the merchant.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.desc: If you encounter issues during the merchant onboarding or bulk registration process, consider the following resolutions:

excel.solution: Ensure the file is in .xlsx format. .xls, .csv, or .ods are not accepted.

excel.issue: Column headers in sheet ‘Merchant’ were modified
excel.solution: Do not rename, remove, or reorder any column headers in the sample Excel.
Every row must contain data for all required fields—especially email, mobile, and registration details.

excel.issue: Excel file does not match the SriPay template
excel.solution: Download the latest sample Excel from the platform and follow the format exactly.

troubleshooting.docSolution: Ensure all document URLs are set to ‘Anyone with the link can view’ before submitting. This allows all reviewers (Sub-Acquirer → SriPay → Alipay) to access them.
kycReasons: Mismatched registration details and document names
troubleshooting.kycSolution: Double-check all entries and uploaded documents before submission.

questions.q: Q1: Can I edit a merchant’s KYC after submission?
questions.a: A: No. Once submitted, edits cannot be made. You must reject the submission and ask the merchant to re-register.

questions.q: Q2: What types of businesses are supported?
questions.a: A: SriPay supports Sole Proprietorships, Partnerships, Private and Public Limited Companies across a wide range of industries.

questions.q: Q3: Can I use my own Merchant ID?
questions.a: A: Yes. If your custom Merchant ID is available, the system will validate and accept it.

questions.q: Q4: What happens after I approve a merchant?
questions.a: A: The request is forwarded to SriPay for second-level review, then to Alipay for final evaluation. You will be notified at each stage.

questions.q: Q5: What if two merchants have the same email?
questions.a: A: Duplicate emails are not allowed. Each merchant must register with a unique email address.
